title: How to Update Steam Games on PC or Mac

steps.headline: Open the Steam app and sign in.
steps.description: The Steam icon looks like part of a gear on a blue background. On a Mac, it’ll be in your Applications folder. On a PC it should be pinned to the Start Menu.

steps.headline: Click on  Library.
steps.description: This will open a list of your installed games.

steps.headline: Click on a game that says “Update Queued” next to the title.
steps.description: This means that particular has a pending update to install. If all of your games are up to date, you won't see this option.

steps.headline: Click  Play to update the game.
steps.description: Before the game launches, a window will come up with a loading bar to show the update’s progress. Click  View Updates or  Play Game after the download is done. You can also just close steam after you install the update. On a Windows PC you’ll get a pop-up notifying you that the update has been downloaded. Click  Agree to allow the game to finish updating.

If all of your games are up to date, you won't see this option. Click  Play to update the game. Before the game launches, a window will come up with a loading bar to show the update’s progress. Click  View Updates or  Play Game after the download is done. You can also just close steam after you install the update. On a Windows PC you’ll get a pop-up notifying you that the update has been downloaded. Click  Agree to allow the game to finish updating.
